# ngx-tailwindcss

> Highly customizable Angular components designed for Tailwind CSS 4+

## Overview

ngx-tailwindcss is an open-source Angular UI component library that provides 30+ components styled with Tailwind CSS. It's designed for Angular 19, 20, and 21, using standalone components and modern Angular features like signals and effects.

## Key Features

- **Tailwind CSS 4+ Ready**: Built for the latest Tailwind with CSS-first configuration
- **Fully Customizable**: Override styling via classOverride/classReplace props or global config
- **Accessible**: WCAG compliant with ARIA attributes, keyboard navigation, focus management
- **Tree-Shakeable**: Import only what you need
- **No Bundled CSS**: Components use your Tailwind config directly
- **Standalone Components**: No NgModule required

## Installation

```bash
pnpm add @pegasus-heavy/ngx-tailwindcss
```

Configure Tailwind to scan the library:

```css
@import "tailwindcss";
@source "../node_modules/@pegasus-heavy/ngx-tailwindcss/**/*.mjs";
```

## Components

### Basic Components
- Button (tw-button): Variants: primary, secondary, success, warning, danger, ghost, outline, link
- Card (tw-card): With header, body, footer sections
- Badge (tw-badge): Status indicators with colors and sizes
- Alert (tw-alert): Dismissible notifications

### Form Controls
- Input (tw-input): Text input with validation states
- Checkbox (tw-checkbox): Single and group checkboxes
- Switch (tw-switch): Toggle switches
- Radio (tw-radio-button, tw-radio-group): Radio button groups
- Select (tw-select): Dropdown selection
- Slider (tw-slider): Range slider
- Rating (tw-rating): Star rating

### Navigation
- Tabs (tw-tabs, tw-tab-panel): Tabbed content
- Menu (tw-menu): Navigation menus
- Breadcrumb (tw-breadcrumb): Path navigation
- Pagination (tw-pagination): Page navigation
- Steps (tw-steps): Step indicators

### Data Display
- Table (tw-table): Data tables with sorting/selection
- Tree (tw-tree): Hierarchical data display
- Timeline (tw-timeline): Event timeline
- Accordion (tw-accordion): Collapsible sections

### Overlays
- Modal (tw-modal): Dialog windows
- Dropdown (tw-dropdown): Dropdown menus
- Popover (tw-popover): Popover content
- Toast (tw-toast): Toast notifications
- Sidebar (tw-sidebar): Slide-out panels

### Feedback
- Progress (tw-progress): Progress bars (linear & circular)
- Spinner (tw-spinner): Loading spinners
- Skeleton (tw-skeleton): Loading placeholders

### Miscellaneous
- Avatar (tw-avatar): User avatars
- Chip (tw-chip): Tags and chips
- Divider (tw-divider): Content separators
- Image (tw-image): Image with preview

## Directives

### Core Directives
- twRipple: Material-style ripple effect
- twTooltip: Tooltips
- twClickOutside: Click outside detection
- twFocusTrap: Focus trapping for modals
- twClass: Intelligent class merging
- twVariant: Apply variant styling

### DX Enhancement Directives
- twAutoFocus: Auto-focus elements on mount
- twInView: Intersection observer for lazy loading/animations
- twLongPress: Long press/touch detection
- twDebounceClick: Debounce click events (prevent double-clicks)
- twCopyClipboard: Copy text to clipboard
- twKeyboardShortcut: Handle keyboard shortcuts (e.g., "ctrl+s")
- twSwipe: Swipe gesture detection (left/right/up/down)
- twResizeObserver: Element size change detection
- twLazyImage: Lazy load images on viewport entry
- twScrollTo: Smooth scroll to elements
- twHoverClass: Dynamic hover state classes
- twTrapScroll: Trap scroll within element (prevent propagation)
- twVariant: Apply variant styling

## Global Configuration

```typescript
import { provideTwConfig } from '@pegasus-heavy/ngx-tailwindcss';

export const appConfig = {
  providers: [
    provideTwConfig({
      animationDuration: 200,
      theme: {
        primary: 'bg-blue-600 hover:bg-blue-700 text-white',
        secondary: 'bg-slate-600 hover:bg-slate-700 text-white',
        // ... more variants
      },
    }),
  ]
};
```

## Per-Component Customization

```html
<tw-button
  variant="primary"
  classOverride="rounded-full px-8">
  Custom Button
</tw-button>
```
